definition: Gore (name)/Al Gore (1948-), US vice-president 1993-2001 under Bill Clinton, subsequently environmental campaigner and Nobel Peace laureate
dagger-axe/abbr. for 戈瑞[ge1 rui4]/(Tw) abbr. for 戈雷[ge1 lei2]
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Rabindranath Tagore (1861-1941), Indian poet and writer

sentences.english: The montgolfier brothers began experimenting by filling small paper bags with smoke.
sentences.chinese: 蒙戈爾菲耶兄弟倆最初的實驗是把煙裝進小紙袋。

sentences.english: We have to recognize it and lessen the impact best we can, " said Gore.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須認清這一點並儘可能減輕其影響，”戈爾說。

sentences.english: Goldberg said researchers have been working with robots for 50 years.
sentences.chinese: 戈爾德貝爾格說研究人員50年來一直研究機器人。

sentences.english: And these cities are also very important cities for GORE-TEX products.
sentences.chinese: 這些城市也是戈爾特斯發展的重點城市。

sentences.english: Golding's novels gain enormously from an understanding of his life.
sentences.chinese: 戈爾丁的小說很大程度得益於他對生活的理解。

sentences.english: Hence the edifice bore the name of the Gorbeau house.
sentences.chinese: 這便是戈爾博老屋這一名稱的由來。

sentences.english: The house and its grounds are now run by Fingal County Council, but the Cobbe family still has access to the house.
sentences.chinese: 住宅和地皮現在由是現在芬戈爾縣地方議會所管理。

sentences.english: Such is Golding's sense of human condition.
sentences.chinese: 所有這些都是戈爾丁對人類境況的悲劇性意識。

sentences.english: We went back to the elevator and got on.I prayed that Mr.Goldstein would be up.
sentences.chinese: 我們乘電梯去樓上，我祈禱戈爾茨坦先生還沒睡。

sentences.english: Gregor was rumored to be discontented and having affairs.
sentences.chinese: 傳聞格雷戈爾對她不滿，有了外遇。

sentences.english: Goldstein is uncertain about the value of the Olympic Games index to investors.
sentences.chinese: 戈爾茨坦不能肯定奧運會指數會對投資者有多少價值。

sentences.english: But Jagoe thinks the services will prevail eventually.
sentences.chinese: 不過，賈戈爾認爲這項服務終將流行。

sentences.english: Intellectuals in Beijing University even gave a Chinese name to Rabindranath Tagore.
sentences.chinese: 北京大學的教授甚至給泰戈爾取了中文名字。

sentences.english: Gorbachev has pursued some more eclectic interests as well.
sentences.chinese: 此外，戈爾巴喬夫的興趣可謂不拘一格。

sentences.english: Almaguer, one of the few people in the central plaza last week.
sentences.chinese: 阿爾瑪戈爾上週在中心廣場上喟嘆道。

definition: Schröder (name)/Gerhard Schröder (1944-), German SPD politician, Chancellor 1998-2005
Kenya (Tw) (written as 肯尼亞|肯尼亚 in PRC)
term of office/while holding a post
